content.question: Japan has a low birth rate and a high life expectancy. Which of the following explains why Japan will struggle with demographic challenges in 30 years?

choices.label: Too many youth dependents for the education system will require increased taxes.
An aging population needing health care will require more public funding.
Too many workers for available jobs will lead to high rates of unemployment.
A rapidly increasing population will strain the countryâ€™s infrastructure.
A rapidly increasing population will strain the available food supply.

content.answer: An aging population needing health care will require more public funding.
